title: Creative Halloween Medusa Photoshoot with Nanlite Pavotubes
summary: Professional photographer Lindsay Adler demonstrates a creative 5-light setup for a Medusa-themed Halloween photoshoot. She details the gear used, specific camera settings for continuous lighting, and a step-by-step process of building a complex lighting scenario using RGB color theory.

steps.action: Introduction to the lighting gear, highlighting features like app control and pixel mapping.
Configure camera settings for the shoot: 1/200 sec shutter speed to freeze motion, f/2.8 aperture for depth of field, and ISO 1000.
Position the first light (Main Light) overhead and set the color to Blue.
Add a second light (Fill Light) from below set to Green to create a 'monster light' effect.
Introduce a third light on the left side set to Orange. This interacts with the blue and green to create complex color mixing.
Add the fourth and fifth lights as white rim lights on either side to separate the subject from the gold background.

key_takeaways: Mixing Red, Green, and Blue light sources can create white light where they overlap and interesting CMYK colors in the shadows.
Modern cameras like the Canon R5 produce clean images even at ISO 1000, making continuous lighting viable for sharp portraits.
Building a lighting setup one light at a time allows for precise control over the mood and color palette.
